Tame Abkluth.flavor: I was unsettled by how some humans learned to tame the Abkluth. If these monsters could be tamed, they could be… domesticated, right? I shuddered at the thought of feeding Abkluth on a farm, treating them when they fell ill, debating what feed to give them. They were monsters. I didn’t want them to feel our kindness.
Tame Abkluth.rawXML:
<unitCast name="TameAbkluth" cooldown="5">
			<beginTargets>
				<target rangeMax="1">
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<enemy/>
							<type name="Abkluth"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affect="Unit">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier effectDescription="OfTargetEnemyAbkluth">
									<effects>
										<changePlayer/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
								<modifier visible="0">
									<effects>
										<removeTrait type="Unleashed"/>
										<removeTrait type="Leashed"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
							<scoreModifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<score add="1.0"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</scoreModifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</target>
			</beginTargets>
		</unitCast>
Tame Abkluth.name: Tame Abkluth

Chant of Harmony.flavor: The Voice knew dark secrets of rebinding flesh and metal. Those who heard its whispers could make the most of them and more easily draw thinking creatures in under its influence. What does anyone want other than the promise that they’ll be safe? The Voice could make that promise—even if it knew it was a lie.

Conjure Bleed.flavor: The Voice has more than one way into our world. It taught some beings how to open holes to another reality. The air itself was like skin, and these tendrils came oozing out. Sometimes you wanted to be surrounded by the Voice. Other times, you wished for a new kind of silence.
Conjure Bleed.rawXML:
<unitCast name="ConjureBleed" cooldown="10">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<conditions>
						<tile>
							<land/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Bleed"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Building"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Fire"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="Forest"/>
							<noFeatureCategory name="SpecialResource"/>
						</tile>
					</conditions>
					<areas>
						<area affect="Tile">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier>
									<effects>
										<addFeature type="Bleed"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
							<scoreModifiers>								
								<modifier>
									<conditions>
										<tile>
											<enemyStrengthInTheArea equal="0"/>
										</tile>
									</conditions>								
									<effects>
										<score add="0.5"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</scoreModifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</unitCast>
Conjure Bleed.name: Conjure Bleed

Causal Well.flavor: A spiraling energy exchange whirled around the Acrin titan. The fingers on its flesh pulsed in and out, sucking the spirit out of anything—machine, human, or Voice cultist—that drew close. Unless it liked you of course. Then those fingers drifted over your skin, giving you a taste of the life it stole.
Causal Well.rawXML:
<unitAction name="CausalWell" icon="Actions/CausalWell" passive="1">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affect="Tile" radius="1">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier effectDescription="ToAdjacentUnits">
									<effects>
										<addTrait type="CausalWell"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</unitAction>
Causal Well.name: Causal Well

Extirpate.flavor: We were safe. We had the shot. We were going to kill a Titan. All those facts fell apart when the beast raised its maw full of limbs and screamed right in our direction. It felt like tendrils gripped our armor and pulled us toward its fleshy mouth. Our time… was up.
Extirpate.rawXML:

Serene Lesion.description: Teleports from Bleed to target sighted Bleed tile
Serene Lesion.name: Serene Lesion

Tunnel.description: Moves underground to target sighted tile
Tunnel.flavor: Only that urge to hear the Voice’s call could send any creature back into the dirt. Could you imagine how deep the Worms went? How great the Earth’s pressure was on them? And then they would come roaring to the surface, their guts expanding as that pressure let up, ready to spew acid that could burn a man alive…
Tunnel.name: Tunnel

Supplication.flavor: A drunk engineer made her way down to our barracks, babbling about her work on the Provost. Talked about code written in languages she'd never seen. Functions that could command all in its presence to listen to its screeching lectures. “That's not fucking code in there,” she said between swigs of toilet ale. “That's primal. Laws of the universe shit. That machine may be closer to God than any of us ever will be.”
Supplication.rawXML:
<unitCast name="Supplication" cooldown="5">
			<beginTargets>
				<selfTarget>
					<areas>
						<area affect="Unit" radius="1" excludeRadius="0">
							<modifiers>
								<modifier effectDescription="ToAdjacentEnemyUnits">
									<conditions>
										<unit>
											<enemy/>
										</unit>
									</conditions>	
									<effects>
										<addTrait type="Supplication" duration="1" removeOnSourceDeath="1"/>
									</effects>
								</modifier>
							</modifiers>
						</area>
					</areas>
				</selfTarget>
			</beginTargets>
		</unitCast>
Supplication.name: Supplication

Holy Bond.flavor: Artillery slammed into our bunker and everything went white. Thought that was it. But for a second I saw—was it a bridge? A hand reaching for me? And then the smoke cleared. We were still standing, and an Akavish Provost lumbered above our unit. “YOUR TIME IS NOT UP!” it shrieked. “THE ONE ABOVE CALLS FOR YOUR BLADES!” The grunts around me cheered and charged. I just stood there… still feeling the brush of that outstretched hand on my palm.

Nomadic Life.description:
Consumes the unit to found a new city on target tile
Cities can only be found where there are no other cities within a %1% tile radius
Each city after the first decreases loyalty in all cities by %2%
Nomadic Life.flavor: Reavers know how to make the wilderness their own. They're skilled at taking the goods they pillage and turning them into supplies for a camp. Be careful if they set up one near your territory—it won't be long before a swarm of them comes crawling
